text: Delyow Derow (Cornish: Oak Leaves) was a literary magazine in Cornish, published from 1988 to 1996 by former Grand Bard of Gorseth Kernow Richard Jenkin. Printed in Robert Morton Nance's Unified Cornish orthography, it published a number of new writers as well as providing a platform for established poets and authors. ==References== Category:Mass media in Cornwall Category:Cornish language Category:Cornish culture Category:Defunct literary magazines published in the United Kingdom Category:Magazines established in 1988 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1996
title: Delyow Derow
